Key Match Events: Josh Smith put Texas ahead for the first time with a two-run single in the seventh inning
Victor Mederos walked the Nos. 8 and 9 batters with two outs
Jose Leclerc retired the only two batters he faced in the seventh
Kirby Yates worked the ninth for his 28th save in 29 chances
Taylor Ward led off the game with his 22nd homer
Zach Neto was hit by a pitch
Jack Leiter retired 15 of the next 17 batters
Ezequiel Duran lined a two-run double
Andrew Chafin's 90 mph sinker on a full count to Nolan Schanuel bounced and ricocheted hard off catcher Jonah Heim toward the Texas dugout, allowing Mickey Moniak's RBI single
Post-Match Reflections: At this point in the season, just to show that fight kind of shows what everybody's made up a little bit, said Smith
We know where we're at, and so it's up to us to keep going out there and playing hard, trying to win ballgames, said manager Bruce Bochy
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Globe Life Park roof was open for the first time since May 17
Taylor Ward extended his on-base streak to 17 games
Jack Leiter had a career-best six strikeouts in his sixth start
Angels starter Tyler Anderson struck out seven and allowed only one hit while throwing 92 pitches in five innings
Jo Adell and Kevin Pillar were placed on the 10-day injured list
Jordyn Adams and Bryce Teodosio were brought up from Triple-A Salt Lake
Two-time Cy Young Award winner Jacob deGrom struck out five without a walk and allowed one hit over four innings for Double-A Frisco
Three-time Cy Young winner Max Scherzer struck out eight of the 14 batters he faced in four scoreless innings for Triple-A Round Rock at Las Vegas
